newsitem.title: USA: Morgan Stanley's Mack to succeed Fisher as CEO.
newsitem.headline: Morgan Stanley's Mack to succeed Fisher as CEO.

text.p: Morgan Stanley Group Inc said its board selected John Mack to become the firm's next chief executive, effective June 1, 1997.
Morgan Stanley said Mack, who will continue as president, was recommended to the post by current chief executive Richard Fisher.
Fisher will continue as chairman after June 1, shifting his principal focus to client and external matters, the company said.
"This is the expected next step in our succession plan," Fisher said in a statement. "This step will allow me to spend more time directly with clients and ensures an orderly transition."
